premises: If an island is volcanic, then it has fertile soil
incorrect conclusions: The island does not have fertile soil
If the island has fertile soil, then it is volcanic
If the island does not have fertile soil, then it is volcanic
If the island is not volcanic, then it does not have fertile soil

premises: If a region is coastal, then it has a maritime climate
conclusions: The region has a maritime climate
incorrect conclusions: The region does not have a maritime climate

If the region is not coastal, then it does not have a maritime climate

premises: If a river flows into the ocean, then it creates a delta
The river flows into the ocean
incorrect conclusions: The river does not create a delta
